title: [K-12] Adolescent Literature-Integrated Instructional Design for Pre-service Agricultural Teachers’ Professional Identity Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic agricultural knowledge and general understanding of secondary education environments
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment centered on text/video content, supplemented by peer feedback and small-group activities.

learning_goals: Learners can design at least three instructional strategies applicable to agricultural education settings by analyzing adolescent literature.

Preservice agricultural education teachers analyze 3 literary texts (e.g., novels on rural life), participate in 2 community discussions for professional identity development, and demonstrate improvement in ≥ 3 of 5 professional awareness items in pre-post surveys.
Create and share integrated agriculture-literature lesson materials using digital tools (such as mobile apps)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
